comments.body: I see when rendering the view which uses the big json strings.
Can you show exactly what you're doing on your View and inside Controller?

answers.body:
First some questions:

  • When you have this exception?
  • When you render your View?
  • When js try to deal with your big object in browser?
  • Or maby in Controller when you try to get this object?

Anyway if you have this error on Server side: your string object is larger than 85000 bytes so your object goes to LOH. That means that your object will be stored in memory for competitive long time until GC at last free memory. And if you use your controller method frequent you definatly can face OOM problem. Try to profile your application under production pressure and take a look at your memory.

title: Big JSON Strings in ASP.NET MVC View
body:
I get Big JSON Objects (about 1.5 MB) in the Controller C1. I stringify it and then keep them in a hidden label in the View V1.

I use the JSON in V1 by parsing it in the JavaScript J1.

I recently saw a

Out of Memory Exception

in the ASP.NET MVC page once in a while.

I am not sure if the big JSON strings in View V1 are causing the issue.

  1. Could the big JSON strings be the issue for the OOM Exception?
  2. Is there a better way to use the big JSON strings in JavaScript J1?
